The defectiveness of the socialistic idea of justice makes itself apparent in the socialistic Olaim of Rights. The rights which Socialists maintain should be added to those already generally and justly recognised are imaginary rights and inconsistent not only with those which have been gained, but with one another.

They are reducible to three-the right to live; the right to labour; and the right 01 each one to receive the entire produce of his labour.
